lexUnit.name: exorbitant.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: unreasonably high in price or amount charged.

sentence.text: Edward took no constructive pains to build support for his rule but was content to make it financially sound , in itself a notable achievement yet one secured at an exorbitant political cost .
Too often , the result is a shabby compromise forced by pressures of exorbitant cost , extended delays and exhausted energies .
If unsuccessful , they were misguided wasters and dreamers ; if successful , they were frauds who got away with selling for exorbitant prices what your little sister did for free .
So every garden , every orchard , every foot of open space within the old confines , was doled out piecemeal at exorbitant prices for building .
It is essential , though , that the knowledge and skills people have are not taken from them , repackaged and sold to them at exorbitant prices .
Exorbitant champagne prices can make the pleasure of marking a special occasion with a bottle or two seem all-too fleeting at such high cost .
Nor , says Mr Imai , should they be allowed to write off the exorbitant sums they spend on promoting group-wide harmony .
Slipped in as if it is a mere trifle , a quite exorbitant price !
Pedulla say that these basses are effectively customs without the exorbitant custom price tag .
All we will have then is a patchwork of networks -- some good , some not so good -- and all no doubt charging even more than the current exorbitant fares .
THE cost of medical insurance could be slashed by ONE FIFTH if greedy hospital consultants cut their exorbitant fees .
Its critics say that even if the waves do not lap over the runway , exorbitant landing fees will frustrate Osaka 's ambitions to displace Seoul as an airline hub for East Asia .

He sat on the couch and started a story the burden of which was to illustrate that Hunter-Blair was being paid an exorbitant amount for his weekly outpourings and that he and Maureen were having an affair .
Somewhat to his own surprise , Harry found himself booking a single room , despite the exorbitant tariff , and following the prim receptionist as she led him to the door .
What are the prospects of disconnection for industrial customers in the coming year if they can not afford to pay the exorbitant increases that the electricity companies are seeking from them ?
There is understandable disillusionment with ludicrous transfer fees and exorbitant wages , and a feeling that some players are not trying hard enough .
This exorbitant sum was considered scandalous by the whole country .
Euro Disney 's costs have been exorbitant , and a slumping French property market has deprived the firm of hoped-for profits from property development .
The expense is exorbitant , the position ridiculous , and the pleasure transitory .
We could n't afford to buy and rents are exorbitant .
Suppose £40 had been an “ exorbitant ” sum .
